definition:
to bring into being by forming, shaping, or altering material : fashion                                      
             
             make a dress

to lay out and construct                                      
             
             make a road

compose, write                                      
             
             make verses

to put together from components : constitute                                      
             
             houses made of stone

to cause to happen to or be experienced by someone                                      
             
             made trouble for us

to cause to exist, occur, or appear : create                                      
             
             make a disturbance

to favor the growth or occurrence of                                      
             
             haste makes waste

to fit, intend, or destine by or as if by creating                                      
             
             was made to be an actor

enact, establish                                      
             
             make laws

to execute (see execute sense 2) in an appropriate manner                                      
             
             make a will

set, name                                      
             
             make a price

to cause to be or become                                      
             
             made them happy

appoint                                      
             
             made him bishop

to cause to act in a certain way : compel                                      
             
             make her give it back

to carry out (an action indicated or implied by the object)                                      
             
             make war

to perform with a bodily movement                                      
             
             make a sweeping gesture

to frame or formulate in the mind                                      
             
             make plans

to set in order                                      
             
             make beds

prepare, fix                                      
             
             make dinner
to assemble and set alight the materials for (a fire)
to shuffle (a deck of cards) in preparation for dealing

to amount to in significance                                      
             
             makes a great difference

to count as                                      
             
             that makes the third time you've said it

to form the essential being of                                      
             
             clothes make the man

to form by an assembling of individuals                                      
             
             make a quorum

to be or be capable of being changed or fashioned into                                      
             
             rags make the best paper

to develop into                                      
             
             she will make a fine judge
form sense 6b

reach, attain                                      
             
             made port before the storm

to gain a place on or in                                      
             
             make the team

to gain the rank of                                      
             
             make major

to succeed in providing or obtaining                                      
             
             make bail

to gain (something, such as money) by working, trading, or dealing                                      
             
             make a living

to act so as to earn or acquire                                      
             
             makes friends easily

to score in a game or sport                                      
             
             make a field goal
to convert (a split) into a spare in bowling

to succeed in holing                                      
             
             make a putt

to conclude as to the nature or meaning of something                                      
             
             what do you make of this development?

to regard as being                                      
             
             not the fool some make him

to produce as a result of action, effort, or behavior with respect to something                                      
             
             make a mess of the job
to turn into another language by translation

to include in a route or itinerary                                      
             
             make New York on the return trip

catch sense 6b                                      
             
             made the bus just in time

to cause or assure the success or prosperity of                                      
             
             can either make you or break you

to provide the most enjoyable or satisfying experience of                                      
             
             meeting the star of the show really made our day

to compute or estimate to be                                      
             
             I make it 23 miles to the border from here.

to form and hold in the mind                                      
             
             make no doubt of it

to begin or seem to begin (an action)                                      
             
             made to go
behave, act
to fulfill (a contract) in a card game
to win a trick (see trick entry 1 sense 4) with (a card)
to prepare (hay) by cutting, drying, and storing
to cause (an electric circuit) to be completed

shut                                      
             
             the doors are made against you
to persuade to consent to sexual intercourse : seduce

to have considerable effect                                      
             
             courtesy makes for safer driving

set out, head                                      
             
             made after the fox

to begin or seem to begin a certain action                                      
             
             made as though to hand it to me

to act so as to be or to seem to be                                      
             
             make merry

behave, act                                      
             
             Don't make as if you didn't hear me.

to play a part                                      
                
                  —usually used with like          make like a chicken

to increase in height or size                                      
             
             the tide is making now

to reach or extend in a certain direction                                      
             
             The forest makes up nearly to the snow line.

to undergo manufacture or processing                                      
             
             the silk makes up beautifully
to compose poetry

to distort one's features : grimace                                      
             
             He made a face when I mentioned her name.
to treat a trifling matter as of great importance

to carry off : steal                                      
             
             made away with all the money
kill

pretend, feign                                      
             
             made believe that everything was all right

venture, dare                                      
             
             making bold to think of himself as a guardian of culture

to accept bets at calculated odds on all the entrants in a race or contest                                      
             
             a bartender who made book on the side

to unite to achieve a shared goal                                      
             
             attempted to make common cause with the radicals in areas they could agree on

to get along or manage with the means at hand                                      
             
             will just have to make do with what we've got

to make one's means adequate to one's needs                                      
             
             did all they could do to make ends meet

ogle                                      
             
             Some guy was making eyes at her from across the room.

to establish a friendship or friendly relations with                                      
             
             made friends with his new neighbors

to make an object of amusement or laughter : ridicule, mock                                      
             
             the movie made fun of macho pretensions
to make valid or complete: such as

to carry out successfully                                      
             
             made good their escape

indemnify                                      
             
             make good the loss

to make up for (a deficiency)                                      
             
             made good previous neglect of his child

prove                                      
             
             made good a charge
to prove to be capable

to make use of a situation or circumstance especially in order to gain an advantage                                      
             
             The candidate made hay of his opponent's scandalous behavior.

to make progress especially against resistance                                      
             
             they made head against the wind

to rise in armed revolt                                      
             
             riflemen who … were called on to make head against a series of resolute efforts to drive them from Kentucky

survive, live                                      
             
             half the cubs won't make it through their first year

to be successful                                      
             
             trying to make it in the big time as a fashion photographer

to be satisfactory or pleasing                                      
             
             if it isn't danceable, it doesn't make it for me
to have sexual intercourse

to treat as of little account                                      
             
             all these problems are humorously described but never made light of
to engage in sexual intercourse
neck, pet
woo, court

to treat as of importance                                      
             
             The drill sergeant made much of his toughness.

to treat with obvious affection or special consideration                                      
             
             she had evidently enjoyed being made much of in Youngstown

to be deliberately and often insincerely polite and agreeable                                      
             
             must make nice to politicians they cannot stand

to be straightforward, unhesitating, or sure                                      
             
             makes no bones about the seriousness of the matter

to achieve success or fame                                      
             
             made his mark as a literary critic

disclose                                      
             
             None of those disagreements were made public.

to set out on a voyage                                      
             
             The ship made sail at midnight.
to raise or spread sail

to manage with difficulty                                      
             
             We didn't have much money, but we made shift.

ridicule, mock                                      
             
             it visibly grieved him when the rest of us made sport of our schoolmates

to measure up to some standard : be successful                                      
             
             clever and energetic enough to make the grade in a good law firm

to show or use to the best advantage                                      
             
             made the most of her talents

to be present at or participate in a usually specified activity or event                                      
             
             small time poets just making the scene at readings or in little mags

to travel fast                                      
             
             made fast time

to gain time                                      
             
             have to make time to get to the bank before it closes

to make progress toward winning favor                                      
             
             trying to make time with the waitress

to go in a hurry : run away, flee                                      
             
             she quickly made tracks for New York
to proceed at a walk or run

to put to use : employ                                      
             
             Students made good use of the new gymnasium.
leak
urinate

to create a stir or disturbance                                      
             
             continues to make waves with his unique, highly opinionated approach

to give room for passing, entering, or occupying                                      
             
             many of the old villas were being torn down to make way for high rises
to make progress

produce, perform                                      
                
                  —usually used with the          Straighten up and walk … make with the feet— Raymond Chandler
brand sense 4a
the manner or style in which a thing is constructed

the physical, mental, or moral constitution of a person                                      
             
             men of his make are rare
the action of producing or manufacturing
the actual yield or amount produced over a specified period : output
the act of shuffling cards
in quest of a higher social or financial status
in search of sexual adventure
in the process of forming, growing, or improving

to form or put together out of material or parts                                      
             
             Do you know how to make a dress?

to cause to exist or occur                                      
             
             Don't make trouble.

to prepare food or drink                                      
             
             She made breakfast for us.

to cause to be or become                                      
             
             Your visit made them happy.

compel sense 1                                      
             
             Grandma will make them go to bed.
to arrange the blankets and sheets on (a bed) so that the mattress is covered

to combine to produce                                      
             
             Two and two make four.

get sense 1, gain                                      
             
             We made a profit on the sale.

reach entry 1 sense 2                                      
             
             We made it home.

do entry 1 sense 1, perform                                      
             
             I'm making a speech.

to act so as to be                                      
             
             Make sure you have your toothbrush.
to act as if something known to be imaginary is real or true
to cause to be the target of laughter in an unkind way

fulfill sense 1, complete                                      
             
             I made good my promise.

to write out                                      
             
             I'll make out a list.

understand sense 1                                      
             
             I can't make out what this says.

identify sense 1                                      
             
             I can't make out who it is.

fare entry 1                                      
             
             How did you make out on your tests?

to create from the imagination                                      
             
             He made up a story.

form entry 2 sense 3, compose                                      
             
             Eleven players make up the team.

to do something to correct or repay a wrong                                      
             
             Volunteer work made up for their mischief.

to become friendly again                                      
             
             They quarreled but later made up.
to put on makeup

decide sense 1                                      
             
             I've finally made up my mind.

brand entry 1 sense 2                                      
             
             What make of car did you buy?

definition: to create or produce something by working
to cause something to be formed by breaking, cutting, or tearing an object or by pushing one object into or through another
used with some nouns for showing that someone performs the action referred to by the noun
used with some nouns for showing that someone says something
to cause someone or something to be in a particular state or to change to another state
to force someone to do something
to arrange or organize something
to earn or get money
to give a particular total when added together
to decide that something gives a particular total when calculating an amount
to cause something to be successful
to have the right qualities for a particular job, purpose etc
to reach a particular place, especially so that there is time to do something
to be able to be present at a particular event
to succeed in achieving something by reaching the necessary level or standard
in: Jane made coffee while the guests were finishing their dessert.
She makes all her own clothes.
made in: This furniture is made in South America.
make something from something: They make paper from old rags.
make something out of something: We made curtains out of some old material we found.
made (out) of something: a bowl made of metal/plastic/wood
make someone something: Joan made me a beautiful dress for my wedding.
make something about someone/something: They’re making a TV programme about the case.
make a hole/scratch/dent etc in something: Something’s made a scratch in the counter.
Over 340 arrests were made.
make an attempt/effort: Helen made no attempt to stop him.
make a decision: No one wanted to make a clear decision on the project.
make a mistake/error: Nobody’s perfect – we all make mistakes.
make progress: We’ve made some progress, but there’s still a long way to go.
make a change/alteration/adjustment etc: People can eat more healthily without making major changes to their diet.
make a contribution: This study makes an outstanding contribution to our understanding of the disease.
make a noise/sound: Stop making so much noise!
make a note of something  (=keep a written record of something): Matthew made a note of the car’s number and informed the police.
make a statement/suggestion/complaint etc: The minister will make a statement on that issue later today.
make someone do something: This film always makes me cry.
make yourself heard/understood etc: I know enough Japanese to make myself understood.
make something difficult/easy etc: The noise in the school makes learning difficult.
make someone feel ill/sad/strange etc: The smell of fish makes me feel ill.
make someone look fat/thin/younger etc: That haircut makes you look ten years younger.
make someone happy/sad/angry etc: Listening to the news just makes me angry these days.
make something nice/pretty/attractive etc: I want to make the place nice for when they arrive.
make someone famous/popular etc: It was television that made her so popular.
make it clear/obvious/plain etc (that): I’d like to make it clear that I had nothing to do with this.
make it known/understood (that): She made it known that she was the mayor’s wife.
make someone something: They made him head teacher after Joanne left.
I’m not going to apologize and you can’t make me!
make someone do something: They made us work for 12 hours a day.
They made him tell the truth by depriving him of food.
be made to do something: We were made to learn fifty new words every week.
make an appointment/date: I’ve made an appointment for you with the doctor for tomorrow morning.
She makes about £2,000 a month.
make money: You can make a lot of money playing the stock market.
make a living  (=make enough money to buy the things that you need): Can you make a living from painting?
make a profit: The company made a small profit in its first year.
Four and two make six.
I make that £750 after tax.
It was the children’s choir that really made the performance.
Diane would make a good teacher – she’s so patient.
Don’t you think the novel would make a great film?
At this rate we won’t make Jedda before midnight.
Dan just managed to make his 7 o’clock flight to Toronto.
We can’t make the conference after all.
We’ve made our target of 10,000 sales this month.
make a deadline: They’ll never make the deadline now that the computers have crashed.
make the headlines/papers/news etc  (=be important enough to be reported): Their search for a heart donor made the headlines in April.
make a team/squad  (=be chosen for it): Dawson has failed to make the team for Saturday’s big match.
it makes a change
make as if to do something
make a bed
make believe
make a difference
make do (with/without something)
make it
make it big
make it 5 o’clock/7.30 etc
make it through something
make it with someone
make like
make or break
make a (phone) call
make time (for)
make way (for)
make your way

definition: to produce something, often using a particular substance or material:
To make a film or television programme is to direct, produce it, or act in it:
to cause something:
to cause to be, to become, or to appear as:
to take action so that you are certain that something happens, is true, etc.:
to force someone or something to do something:
to be forced to do something:
to perform an action:
If you make room/space/way for something or someone, you move your body or move other things, so that there is space for it, him, or her.
to pull up and tidy the covers on a bed after it has been slept in:
to produce a total when added together:
to calculate as:
to earn or get:
to arrive at or reach, especially successfully:
to succeed in getting a place in a team:
to appear as a story in the news:
to cause to be perfect:
a type of product or the name of the company that made it:
to bring something into existence, esp. using a particular substance or material; produce:
to cause something to be, become, or appear in a particular way:
To make the bed is to put sheets and covers on a bed so that someone can sleep in it, or to straighten them after it has been slept in.
to be or become something, esp. by having the necessary characteristics:
to add up to (a total):
to arrive at or reach:
a particular product, or the name of the company that made it:
to produce or prepare goods, etc.:
to earn or receive money:
to do a particular thing:
to say something officially or formally:
to choose someone as something, or employ someone as something:
to cause someone or something to be in a particular state:
to be ready, willing, and able to buy or sell particular bonds, shares, etc. as a dealer:
to pay, lend, invest, etc. money:
to earn or lose more money than you spend:
to make something successful:
to become rich and successful:
to reduce the bad effect of there not being enough of something, for example money:
to pay for or repair something that has been damaged:
to do something that you have promised to do, for example paying back money that you owe or paying for the cost of damage you have caused:
to cause someone or something either to be very successful, or to cause them to fail:
the name of a product made by a particular company, rather than by other companies that make similar products:
to be trying very hard to get more money or power for yourself:
in: Do you want me to make some coffee?
He made a chocolate cake.
She makes all her own clothes.
He made us some coffee./He made some coffee for us.
The pot is made to withstand high temperatures.
He works for a company that makes furniture.
The label on the box said "made in China".
Butter is made out of/from milk.
earrings made of gold
Her new trainer has promised to make an Olympic athlete of her.
John Huston made some great movies.
The movie was made by Goldcrest Productions.
So why didn't Garbo make any films after 1941?
The kids made a real mess in the kitchen.
The bullet made a hole right through his chest.
The wind is making my eyes water.
What made you change your mind?
Just seeing Woody Allen's face is enough to make me laugh.
The photograph makes me look about 80!
It's the good weather that makes Spain such a popular tourist destination.
She had to shout to make herself heard above the sound of the music.
I can make myself understood in French, but I'm not fluent.
They went up to the Ambassador and made themselves known (to her).
The company accounts have not yet been made public.
The book's advertised as "navigation made easy".
The president has made Henry Paulson his Secretary of the Treasury.
I'll have a steak - no, make that chicken.
I'll just make sure I've turned the oven off.

Make sure you're home by midnight.

On foot they could only make about 20 miles a day.
We must make a decision by tomorrow.
You're not making any effort.
Someone has made a mistake/an error.
We're making good progress.

Is it time to make a start on the work?
Can I make a suggestion?

There's a drunk at the door making trouble.

12 and 12 make 24.

I make the answer (to be) 105.6.

We make software that allows mobile employees to connect securely to their corporate networks.

All our coffee is made from beans sourced locally.

They made $500,000 in total on the deal.
In this area it's hard to make a living as a gardener.
No major decisions are made without the CEO's approval.
The deal includes a $25 million break-up fee, which could encourage other bidders to make a competing offer.
The audit makes a series of recommendations.

One of the project's key goals is to make the website available in different languages.
Western investment banks are being allowed to make a market in Chinese domestic shares.
Shareholders may authorize a third party, such as a bank or employer, to make investments directly to their Fund accounts.
